techmeme.title: Sources: OpenAI is recruiting from Apple's design, manufacturing, and supply chain teams, as it targets late 2026 or early 2027 for its first devices (The Information)
Mastodon, the nonprofit that maintains the social network, plans to offer paid hosting, moderation, and support services for organizations joining the fediverse (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
Sources: Nvidia is in advanced discussions to invest $500M in UK self-driving car startup Wayve, as part of a £2B pledge for UK startups; Wayve is evaluating (Tim Bradshaw/Financial Times)
Envision Capital, which facilitated ByteDance investments, says a TikTok US deal boosted ByteDance valuation from $230B in early 2025 to $400B in private deals (CNBC)
A look at China's brain-computer interface industry as startups like BrainCo grow with state support; CCID says the sector is worth ~$450M, growing 20% annually (Bloomberg)
